title: papundekli22
author: papundekli22
content: Hi i offer a bot for claiming faucets automatic.Working for all kind of faucet websites also pass all type of captcha Python code for claiming faucets automatically you only need to setup :claiming time (Basic setup 5 Min)                                                                                                       :Login details for faucet website(email,pass)                                                                                                      :Custom USER SETTINGS !Do it only when *When the claiming button have different name* exchange the button name in script for the button name from website !1.Open the script.py file in Notepad and edit your details (Time,email,pass,*button name when it is needed*)2.Enter your details and save the script.3.Save your file (script.py)  4.Now just run the run.bat file 5.WOOOOW ITS WORKINGGTested on different faucet sites like:(Lucky Block,Cointiply,Rollercoin,FreeBitco.in,Altcoins.pw)Price : 5 USD  Acceptable all kind(Also altcoins) of crypto or PaypalI offer this script for everyone who want made the job easily and automatize everything.If you want the script Just PM me with your choosen method of pay ( I provide the choosen coin wallet) and i provide download linkThis script is unique and written and tested by my group. 100% wroking

comments.author: lacko
comments.body: Hello,I am interesting to buying the BOT.Post a short video of how the BOT works on rollercoin website.

comments.author: papundekli22
comments.body: Short Description about bot : To use this script, you only need to replace "Your_Faucet_Address" with your actual faucet address. The script sends a GET request to the Allcoins.pw faucet URL and extracts the claim status message using the BeautifulSoup library. It then prints the claim status message and waits for the specified claim interval before attempting to claim again.You can save this script as a .py file and run it using a Python interpreter, or you can run it directly in the terminal using the command python script_name.py. Make sure you have the necessary modules installed (requests and BeautifulSoup) before running the script.
